description: Explore resource extraction, hazard assessment, and geological applications

slides.title: Welcome to Geological Engineering
slides.content:
# Introduction to Geological Engineering

Welcome to **Geological Engineering** - applying geology to solve problems!

## What You Will Learn:
- **Resource Extraction** - Mining and drilling
- **Hazard Assessment** - Earthquakes, landslides
- **Groundwater** - Finding and managing water
- **Site Investigation** - Building foundations

> **Fun Fact:** Geological engineers help find everything from water to gold!

slides.title: Mineral Resources
slides.content:
# Mineral Resources

## Types:

| Category | Examples |
|----------|----------|
| Metallic | Iron, copper, gold, aluminum |
| Non-metallic | Sand, gravel, limestone |
| Energy | Coal, uranium |
| Gemstones | Diamonds, emeralds |

## Ore Formation:
- Magmatic concentration
- Hydrothermal deposits
- Sedimentary processes
- Weathering (bauxite)

## Mining Methods:

| Method | Use |
|--------|-----|
| Open pit | Large, shallow deposits |
| Underground | Deep deposits |
| Placer | River sediments |
| Solution | Dissolve minerals in place |

slides.title: Fossil Fuels
slides.content:
# Fossil Fuels

## Types:

| Fuel | Formation |
|------|----------|
| Coal | Swamp plants, pressure |
| Oil | Marine organisms, heat/pressure |
| Natural Gas | Same as oil, more heat |

## Oil Traps:
- Structural: Anticlines, faults
- Stratigraphic: Pinch-outs, reefs
- Impermeable cap rock required

## Extraction:
- Drilling (conventional)
- Hydraulic fracturing (fracking)
- Enhanced oil recovery

## Environmental Concerns:
- Greenhouse gases
- Oil spills
- Groundwater contamination
- Habitat disruption

slides.title: Hazard Assessment
slides.content:
# Hazard Assessment

## Earthquake Hazards:
- Seismic risk maps
- Building codes
- Fault identification
- Liquefaction potential

## Landslides:
- Slope stability analysis
- Warning signs: cracks, tilting
- Mitigation: drainage, retaining walls

## Volcanoes:
- Hazard zones mapping
- Monitoring (seismic, gas, tilt)
- Evacuation planning

## Floods:
- Floodplain mapping
- Return periods
- Levees, dams, diversion

## Subsidence:
- Groundwater withdrawal
- Mining
- Sinkholes

slides.title: Groundwater Engineering
slides.content:
# Groundwater Engineering

## Finding Water:
- Geophysical surveys
- Well logs
- Aquifer mapping

## Well Design:
- Drill to aquifer
- Screen in productive zone
- Pump testing

## Aquifer Properties:

| Property | Meaning |
|----------|--------|
| Porosity | % void space |
| Permeability | How water flows |
| Transmissivity | Flow capacity |
| Storativity | Water released |

## Contamination:
- Point sources (spills, landfills)
- Non-point (agriculture)
- Remediation methods

## Sustainable Use:
- Recharge rate
- Overdraft problems
- Saltwater intrusion

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Geological Engineering Summary

## Resources:
| Type | Examples |
|------|----------|
| Metallic ores | Iron, copper, gold |
| Fossil fuels | Coal, oil, gas |

## Hazards:

- Assessment and mitigation
- Building codes and mapping

## Groundwater:
- Aquifer properties
- Well design
- Contamination prevention

## Applications:
- Mining and drilling
- Site investigation
- Environmental protection

> **Congratulations!** You've completed Geological Engineering!
